HeadersSet.summary:
The set() method of the interface
sets a new value for an existing header inside a Headers object, or adds
the header if it does not already exist.

remarks.para:
The difference between set() and is that if
the specified header already exists and accepts multiple values, set()
overwrites the existing value with the new one, whereas
appends the new value to the end of the set of values.

For security reasons, some headers can only be controller by the user agent. These
headers include the Forbidden_header_name
and Forbidden_response_header_name.
